business.headline: A will, a letter, and a brewing dispute: Sunjay Kapur's mother vs Sona ComstarAs Sunjay Kapur's mother takes on Sona Comstar, the unfolding dispute could shape into a high-stakes clash of legacy, legality, and loss in one of India's storied business families.

Joint home loan or personal loan? What's smarter for young couples buying propertyBuying your first home as a couple is exciting, but figuring out how to finance it? That's where things get tricky. Should you go for a joint home loan or take a personal loan? Let's break it down.

How taxes drove Formula 1 out of IndiaFormula 1 didn't leave India because of a lack of fans or infrastructure. It left because of unclear policies, tax confusion, and a system that didn't treat it like a sport.

Meta hires ChatGPT co-creator as chief scientist to lead new AI labMeta has appointed ChatGPT co-creator Shengjia Zhao as chief scientist of its new Superintelligence Lab, aiming to advance AGI and regain AI leadership after Llama 4's weak performance.

Explained: Why India-UK free trade agreement is a big deal for both nationsIndia and the United Kingdom have formally sealed a Comprehensive Economic and Trade Agreement, a deal described as the "biggest, most economically significant trade deal that the UK has made since leaving the EU."

Not a shareholder, no coercion: Sunjay Kapur's firm counters mother's chargesThe clarification comes after it was reported that Rani Kapur had written a letter to delay the AGM and alleged that she was made to sign documents shortly after her son's death.

Remainers will choke on their cornflakes: British media hails India trade dealThe India-UK Free Trade Agreement (FTA) or the Comprehensive Economic and Trade Agreement (CETA) seeks to enhance bilateral trade by around USD 34 billion annually, besides ensuring better market access.

FTAs with EU, US in talks, says Commerce Secretary after India-UK trade dealThe agreement now needs to pass through both houses of the British Parliament. A special committee will study it before giving final approval.

Everyone wants to be an influencer. But can it pay the bills?The creator economy in India is booming, but the economics remain shaky. What started as a hobby or side hustle for many is now a full-time hustle, and an increasingly competitive one.

Sensex ends 721 points lower, Nifty below 24,900; Bajaj Finance falls 5%The S&P BSE Sensex was down 721.08 points to 81,463.09 at the closing bell, while the NSE Nifty50 declined 225.10 points to trade at 24,837.

Sunjay Kapur's mother alleges business coercion, attempt to 'usurp family legacy'Rani Kapur has publicly objected to what she calls an "inappropriate and premature" AGM, held during a period of deep mourning, and raised serious concerns over how decisions are being made in the aftermath.

entertainment.headline: My little princess: AR Rahman celebrates daughter Raheema's graduationAR Rahman recently celebrated his daughter Raheema's graduation. The singer posted pictures from the ceremony in Switzerland.

Hari Hara Veera Mallu box office Day 3: Pawan Kalyan's film faces weekend slumpPawan Kalyan's 'Hari Hara Veera Mallu' saw a sharp decline at the box office on Day 3, earning Rs 9.25 crore nett after a strong Rs 34 crore nett opening.

GoT star Nikolaj Coster-Waldau savours idli at Bengaluru's Rameshwaram Cafe. Watch'Game of Thrones' actor Nikolaj Coster-Waldau surprised Indian fans as he was clicked enjoying South Indian cuisine at Bengaluru's popular Rameshwaram Cafe. Several videos and pictures of his trip have gone viral.

Actor Vineet Kumar, wife Ruchiraa welcome baby boy: He's already stealing heartsActor Vineet Kumar Singh and wife  Ruchiraa Gormaray have been blessed with a baby boy. The 'Chhaava' actor announced the news on social media.

Priyanka-Nick enjoy BLACKPINK's New York concert, dance to APT. WatchPriyanka Chopra and Nick Jonas attended BLACKPINK's concert in New York, sharing fun moments from the event on social media. Chopra praised Lisa as a queen.

Kingdom trailer: Vijay Deverakonda embarks on deadly mission as an undercover spyThe trailer of 'Kingdom' starring Vijay Deverakonda in the lead is out. The action-entertainer will release in theatres on July 31.

Parag Tyagi posts emotional tribute for Shefali Jariwala from pet SimbaParag Tyagi posted a video collage of Shefali Jariwala with Simba, capturing their cherished moments together after a month of the actor's death.

Saiyaara box office Day 9: Ahaan-Aneet's love story becomes year's 2nd biggest hitMohit Suri's romantic drama 'Saiyaara', featuring Ahaan Panday and Aneet Padda, has raced into the Rs 200 crore club, collecting Rs 217.25 crore in India in just nine days.

War 2: How much Jr NTR and Hrithik Roshan are earning for Ayan Mukerji's filmWith excitement at an all-time high for 'War 2', fans would be eager to know how much Jr NTR and Hrithik Roshan earned for their role in Ayan Mukerji's upcoming action-entertainer.

Kajol opens up on cosmetic surgery, says it's a personal choice not to be judgedActor Kajol opened up about cosmetic surgery and aging, calling both personal choices that shouldn't be judged. She said aging is a privilege and not something to fear, adding that men also undergo cosmetic procedures just like women.

Pak TikToker found dead, daughter claims she was poisoned for refusing marriagePakistani TikToker Sumeera Rajput was found dead under suspicious circumstances in Sindh's Ghotki district, with her daughter alleging she was poisoned over pressure to marry forcibly. Two suspects have been arrested, but the motive remains unconfirmed as investigations continue.

Zareen Khan slams trolls for age-shaming: Will marriage make me young again?Actor Zareen Khan gave a sharp and witty response to an ageist troll who told her to get married because she's getting old. She questioned the mindset of people behind their words.

Smriti Irani, Ektaa Kapoor to visit Nathdwara temple ahead of Kyunki rebootSmriti Irani and Ektaa Kapoor will visit Nathdwara Temple in Rajasthan on July 27 to seek blessings ahead of the premiere of 'Kyunki Saas Bhi Kabhi Bahu Thi' Season 2.

Thalaivan Thalaivii box office Day 1: Vijay Sethupathi's film earns Rs 4.15 crorePandiraj's Thalaivan Thalaivii, featuring Vijay Sethupathi and Nithya Menen, opened to an encouraging start at the box office, earning Rs 4.15 crore on day one.

Smriti Irani shares Miss India connection with Gauri Pradhan ahead of Kyunki 2Actor-politician Smriti Irani shared that she and Gauri Pradhan were Miss India finalists in 1998, long before becoming the iconic saas-bahu duo in 'Kyunki Saas Bhi Kabhi Bahu Thi'.

Malayalam producer files nomination in burqa after legal battle with film chamberMalayalam producer Sandra Thomas filed her nomination papers in a burqa amid a legal battle with the Kerala Film Producers Association (KFPA).
Akshay Kumar returns to ramp as showstopper after 12 years. WatchAkshay Kumar made a grand return to the ramp after 12 years as the showstopper for Falguni Shane Peacock at India Couture Week 2025.

SEVENTEEN's Joshua breathes new life into Slander's Love Is GoneSEVENTEEN's Joshua brings a heartfelt new twist to Love Is Gone with American DJs SLANDER, showcasing his unique vocal tone. This collaboration marks another step in his growing global music journey as SEVENTEEN gears up for their world tour.

Diljit distributes sweets as he wraps Border 2, Varun Dhawan, Ahan Shetty reactDiljit Dosanjh has wrapped the shooting of his upcoming film 'Border 2'. In a video shared by the singer-turned-actor, he distributed sweets on the sets.

general news.headline: Chaos at Haridwar temple as video shows crowd asked to go back after stampedeAt least six people were killed and over 25 injured in the stampede at the Mansa Devi temple in Haridwar on Sunday after a massive crowd gathered along the stairway route of the popular shrine, officials said.

Raj Thackeray enters Matoshree after 6 years with roses for cousin UddhavThe visit comes weeks after both leaders were seen together at public rally in Mumbai. Raj Thackeray was joined by senior MNS leaders Bala Nandgaonkar and Nitin Sardesai during the visit.

From death certificate to marriage certificate: Journey of HIV-positive IndiansBeing declared HIV-positive was akin to a death sentence in India of the 1990s. With new medicines, lifespan is not an issue any more. And now, more and more HIV-positive individuals are getting married, and having healthy kids. Matrimonial sites have launched sections focused on HIV+ individuals. This is how science and activism have turned stigma into happily-ever-after stories.

Day 5 Live: Gill crosses 700 runs, matches Gavaskar in elite featIndia (IND) vs England (ENG), 4th Test, Day 4 Live Updates: Shubman Gill and KL Rahul have made a steady start to the innings after rain stays away in Manchester. The Indian skipper has also gone past 700 runs in this series, creating a historic feat.

Can India unite for its biggest war?The target is clear. India needs to be Viksit Bharat by 2047. But half of the second decade of this century is over like the two before. To make up for the lost decades, India needs to grow faster to be counted among high-income nations. AI is now challenging the very sector on which India grew for two decades. It's the time for reforms at a war-footing and manufacturing, not consents and dissents, but what the world needs. Because, for Indians, it is now or never.

Pak-linked conversion racket busted in Agra, used online games to target Hindu girlsInvestigators revealed that the network used social media, online gaming platforms like LudoStar, encrypted messaging apps and the dark web to operate. Police said girls were approached for religious conversion by individuals in Pakistan.

Ex-Maharashtra minister's son-in-law, 6 others arrested after raid at rave partyPune police raided a rave party and arrested seven individuals, including the son-in-law of former Maharashtra Minister Eknath Khadse.

Why the India-UK free trade pact is a calculated embraceA deep dive into the historic Comprehensive Economic and Trade Agreement—what it offers, what are the risks, and why it marks a bold phase in India's global economic diplomacy

Boeing jet catches fire on runway in US, panicked passengers slide out amid smokeThe plane, operating as Flight 3023 to Miami, was carrying 173 passengers and six crew members when the mechanical issue unfolded on Saturday afternoon.

6 dead, over 25 injured in stampede at Haridwar's Mansa Devi TempleThe stampede occurred on the stairway route to Mansa Devi temple amid a massive rush, with preliminary reports suggesting panic may have spread in the crowd.

A will, a letter, and a brewing dispute: Sunjay Kapur's mother vs Sona ComstarAs Sunjay Kapur's mother takes on Sona Comstar, the unfolding dispute could shape into a high-stakes clash of legacy, legality, and loss in one of India's storied business families.

Draped in veshti and angavastram, PM visits iconic Cholapuram Temple in Tamil NaduOn Rajendra Chola I's birth anniversary, PM Modi visited the 11th-century Gangaikonda Cholapuram Temple in Tamil Nadu, offering prayers and participating in Aadi Thiruvathirai festivities.

Noida girl, 5, dies after BMW hits scooter; was being taken to hospital by fatherTwo college students were arrested after their speeding BMW rammed into a scooty in Noida's Sector 30, killing a 5-year-old girl and critically injuring two others.

How Rajendra I Chola became ruler of the seas and led an expedition to far EastUnlike the Indian rulers, Rajendra I Chola ventured to conquer foreign soil. During his rule, he defeated the rulers of Southeast Asia and conquered parts of present-day Indonesia, Thailand, Myanmar, and Sumatra. He led the naval expedition, and India has a Navy training ship named TS Rajendra in his honour. The Chola Empire under him became one of the wealthiest empires of the time, developing connections with Song China in the east and the Arabs in the west.

From 'India Out' to red carpet for Modi: How Delhi turned Maldives aroundFrom "India Out" in the Maldives in 2023 to President Muizzu breaking protocol to receive PM Modi, the turnaround in Delhi-Male ties might seem surprising. India kept aiding the Maldives despite Muizzu's seemingly hostile attitude towards India. Ultimately, it seems like it has paid off.

Consumer is king, to be ripped off their kingdom by crafty corporatesCompanies in general don't invest in consumer awareness, not due to oversight, but by design, as keeping the consumer uninformed is profitable. Consumer awareness is not just about knowing your rights, it is about knowing you have the right to ask questions.

Indian woman lands in Dubai for job in beauty parlour, then a drug twistAmeena's mother has made an urgent plea to the Ministry of External Affairs seeking immediate assistance to bring her daughter back safely.

PM Modi attends musical performance by Ilaiyaraaja at Gangaikonda Cholapuram festAt the grand threefold celebration held at Gangaikonda Cholapuram, Ilaiyaraaja's spiritual music concert took place, which was admired and enjoyed by Prime Minister Narendra Modi.
Why 'Saiyaara' is all the rageIn Ahaan Panday and Aneet Padda, Bollywood after long has newcomers who, in their very first film, have made a solid case that they have the thespian chops to shine on

Sanjay Manjrekar slams Gautam Gambhir's team selection in England TestsSanjay Manjrekar has criticised Gautam Gambhir's selection choices in the Test series against England. Manjrekar said that Gambhir's affinity towards having a fourth seamer made little sense.

Different PM, different BJP: On Pahalgam, Congress compares Modi with VajpayeeA day before Parliament debates Operation Sindoor, Congress's Jairam Ramesh slammed at PM Modi over the Pahalgam attack, citing Vajpayee-era accountability and questioning the incumbent government's response.

Retained in mega-auction, Nitish Reddy contemplating SunRisers Hyderabad exitIndia all-rounder Nitish Reddy wants to leave his IPL franchise SunRisers Hyderabad. India Today has learnt that Nitish wants a more defining role with the bat in the IPL, which he did not get at the franchise last season.

Went through my wrist: Indian-origin man, 33, attacked with machete in AustraliaThe 33-year-old was ambushed outside a shopping centre, suffering multiple stab wounds, a fractured spine, and the near-severing of his hand in what police have described as a vicious assault.

Vijay Deverakonda, Bhagyashrii Borse visit Tirupati temple ahead of Kingdom releaseVijay Deverakonda and Bhagyashrii Borse visited the Tirupati Venkateswara Swamy Temple ahead of their film 'Kingdom's release on July 31. The videos of their visit have emerged online.

sports.headline: Shubman Gill becomes first India captain with 700-plus runs in away Test seriesShubman Gill became the first Indian captain to score more than 700 runs in an away Test series, reaching the milestone during the fourth Test of the Anderson-Tendulkar Trophy in Manchester.

Missed it once, will do it again: Shikhar Dhawan on potential IND vs PAK clash in WCLShikhar Dhawan said that he won't take part in the semi-final of the World Championship of Legends if India will have to face Pakistan. Shikhar was amongst one of the players who missed the league game against Pakistan.

WUG 2025: Jadhav wins gold as Indian archers finish with 5-medal haulIt was a memorable day for the Indian compound archer as Sahil Jadhav added to India's medal haul while the relay teams have qualified for the final event.

Day 5 Live: Gill crosses 700 runs, matches Gavaskar in elite featIndia (IND) vs England (ENG), 4th Test, Day 4 Live Updates: Shubman Gill and KL Rahul will start on the final day of the 4th Test match, hoping to keep India alive in the series. There is a rain threat in Manchester which might disrupt play heavily in the morning session.

Players need more pride when playing for India: Manolo MarquezManolo Marquez reflected on his time as the manager of the Indian football team. He suggested that players needed more pride when playing for the national team and backed his decision to bring back Sunil Chhetri from international retirement.

IND vs PAK boycotted in WCL, but gets Asia Cup go-ahead: Kaneria slams hypocrisyDanish Kaneria has slammed the hypocrisy of Indian players for snubbing the WCL game against Pakistan but being ready to play them in the Asia Cup. India and Pakistan could potentially square off three times during the Asia Cup.

Viktor Gyokeres eager to repay early support from Arsenal fanbase after moveViktor Gyokeres has signed a five-year deal with Arsenal, and is excited to repay the early fan support he got before coming to the club. Gyokeres has signed a five-year deal with the club on Saturday, July 26.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
